etymology.description: 雨(雨) (yǔ, "rain") + phonetic: 申(申) (shēn) = electrical phenomena during a storm -> electricity
etymology.interpretation: The character 电(電) (diàn, "electricity") combines semantic and phonetic elements to represent natural electric phenomena, like lightning, associated with rainstorms. This reflects how electricity is tied to natural forces.
etymology.simplification: 电(電) was simplified by removing the rain radical 雨(雨) (yǔ, "rain") while maintaining the central component 申(申) (shēn) for phonetic representation.

examples.pinyin: Xiàn dài kē jì yī lài diàn(電)。

examples.chinese: 办公室里的电器都已更新(辦公室裡的電器都已更新)，节约能源效果显著(節約能源效果顯著)。
examples.pinyin: Bàn gōng shì lǐ de diàn qì dōu yǐ gēng xīn(辦公室裡的電器都已更新)，jié yuē néng yuán xiào guǒ xiǎn zhù(節約能源效果顯著)。
examples.english: The office appliances have all been updated, and the energy-saving results are remarkable.

examples.chinese: 夜晚的城市因电光闪烁(夜晚的城市因電光閃爍)，显得异常璀璨(顯得異常璀璨)。
examples.pinyin: Yè wǎn de chéng shì yīn diàn guāng shǎn shuò(夜晚的城市因電光閃爍)，xiǎn de yì cháng cuǐ càn(顯得異常璀璨)。
examples.english: The city at night shines with the gleam of electricity, appearing exceptionally dazzling.
